Posts.Content: May 28, 2010 10:37PM dallehouse wrote: just got the results of my follow-up PET scan.... and it's NED!!!!! the spots are gone!  i am completely floored and floating on air!  thanks for your support.   i still have a bit of chest pain and a slight cough but i'm gonna chalk it up to allergies for now!  have a great memorial day weekend.  xxoo, larissa
Posts.Title: Lymphangitic lung spread cwrightrn joju

Posts.Content: May 17, 2010 10:03PM dallehouse wrote: hi.  i'm new to this board.  a recent CT showed ground glass opacities on my right lung (non-cancer/non-radiation side).  i was dx w/stage IIb breast cancer 8 years ago.  this january i went for a regular follow-up with onc.  i had been having an ongoing cough.  onc ordered a CT which showed ground glass opacities.  and PET scan confirmed.  my onc said my spots were too small to biopsy.  i'm having a follow-up PET scan next week to see if there is growth.  i will let you know what i find out.  praying this is just some benign inflammation.  i hope your cough subsides.  please keep us posted.  - larissa
Posts.Title: Lymphangitic lung spread cwrightrn joju

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2010 01:37PM dallehouse wrote: i got the written copy of PET scan in the mail.  i always ask for these since i live 2 hours from my onc's office (i moved to middle o'nowhere 3 years ago to become a goat farmer).  anyways, i'm so confused.  the scan does say there are no suspicious nodules.  yay.  however, it states that i have mild centrilobular emphysema in the upper lungs.  i can't believe my onc didn't mention this.  i suppose this is what has been causing all my breathing/coughing troubles.   i saw a pulmonary specialist a few months back.  he couldn't find anything wrong with me based on my previous scans or a pulmonary function test.  i wonder why this is just now showing up.  i have another appointment with specialist in july.   has emphysema ever showed up on anyone elses's scans? - larissa
